ACT
5
GENERAL PROVISIONS
Whoever has inherited a person is his general legal successor.
Upon the testator's death, his estate passes to the heir, thereby becoming his inheritance.
The estate consists of everything that was the decedent's at the time of his death, except for what cannot be inherited due to its legal nature or by law. However, inheritance is not someone else's share in joint property or what someone acquires at the time of the testator's death on a special legal basis.
